name: Congo Free State
description: King Leopold II's personal colony in Congo, run as a forced labor camp to extract rubber. Workers who failed to meet quotas had their hands cut off. Systematic brutality, hostage-taking, and punitive expeditions killed approximately ten million Congolese.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Leopold II's personal colony. Force Publique enforced rubber quotas with mutilation and hostage-taking.
rationales.profit: Pure extraction: rubber, ivory. Leopold became one of world's richest men. Quintessential profit atrocity.
rationales.ideology: Framed as 'civilizing mission' but no ethnic purification goal. Pure exploitation.
rationales.complicity: European consumers bought rubber products. Other powers looked away. Leopold's propaganda effective.

analysis.pattern_note: Driven purely by extraction. Propaganda marked False because they didn't try to convince the victims, they just enslaved them.
analysis.root_causes: Personal greed (Leopold II), rubber demand, lack of international accountability

sources.title: Red Rubber: The Story of the Rubber Slave Trade
sources.author: E.D. Morel

sources.title: The Congo: From Leopold to Kabila
sources.author: Georges Nzongola-Ntalaja
